column4: Is it possible to use mdadm to re-assemble a 4-disk ntfs RAID0+1 array without losing the data? Initially setup with mobo fakeraid, I believe.
lots of important files on that raid?
It's my storage array.  I kept pretty much everything on it in my Windows setup.
well..start windows and copy the files over to something else.. buy a new motherboard if the old one is dead
Windows install is long gone. Part of the motivation to switch to Ubuntu. :)
I was in the same situation a couple of years back.. but then the motherboard was out of production.. I've still got the hard drives in a box
So my best option is to reinstall Windows to make Ubuntu work? :)
hehe.. well.. installing windows is pretty quick.. it shouldn't take more than a day to install, get the raid up and then copy the files somewhere else
afaik yes.. there might be raid-gurus out there that can help you but that's what I'd do
got a Terabyte external drive I could borrow? :)
nah.. but I've got 3 internal ones. =/
but those western digitial mybook drives are pretty neat.. you can use it for backup when you're done
Now if I only had the money to buy one. :)
ah.. can't help you there.. unfortunately

some advice for the future.. either go for real raid cards (the expensive ones).. or don't use raid at all.. (or pure software raid). Fakeraid isn't faster, better or cheaper.. it's just more likely to lose your files
